verses.verse: Now there was a man<WH376> of Benjamin<WH1144>, whose name<WH8034> was Kish<WH7027>, the son<WH1121> of Abiel<WH22>, the son<WH1121> of Zeror<WH6872>, the son<WH1121> of Becorath<WH1064>, the son<WH1121> of Aphiah<WH647>, the son of a Benjamite<WH1145>, a mighty<WH1368> man<WH376> of valor<WH2428>.

And he had a son<WH1121>, whose name<WH8034> was Saul<WH7586>, a young man<WH970> and a goodly<WH2896>: and there was not among the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> a goodlier<WH2896> person<WH376> than he<WH7926>: from his shoulders and upward<WH4605> he was higher<WH1364> than any of the people<WH5971>.

And the asses<WH860> of Kish<WH7027>, Saul<WH7586>'s father<WH1>, were lost<WH6>. And Kish<WH7027> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586> his son<WH1121>, Take<WH3947> now one<WH259> of the servants<WH5288> with thee<WH6965>, and arise, go<WH3212> seek<WH1245> the asses<WH860>.

And he passed through<WH5674> the hill-country<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669>, and passed through<WH5674> the land<WH776> of Shalishah<WH8031>, but they found<WH4672> them not<WH5674>: then they passed through the land<WH776> of Shaalim<WH8171>, and there they were not<WH5674>: and he passed through the land<WH776> of the Benjamites<WH1145>, but they found them not<WH4672>.

When they were come<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Zuph<WH6689>, Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to his servant<WH5288> that was with him<WH3212>, Come, and let us return<WH7725>, lest my father<WH1> leave<WH2308> off caring for the asses<WH860>, and be anxious for us<WH1672>.

And he said<WH559> unto him<WH5892>, Behold now, there is in this city a man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and he is a man<WH376> that is held in honor<WH3513>; all that he saith<WH1696> cometh<WH935> surely to pass<WH935>: now let us go<WH3212> thither<WH5046>; peradventure he can tell us concerning our journey<WH1870> whereon we go<WH1980>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586> to his servant<WH5288>, But<WH3212>, behold, if we go, what shall we bring<WH935> the man<WH376>? for the bread<WH3899> is spent<WH235> in our vessels<WH3627>, and there is not a present<WH8670> to bring<WH935> to the man<WH376> of God<WH430>: what have we?

And the servant<WH5288> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586> again<WH3254>, and said<WH559>, Behold<WH4672>, I have in my hand<WH3027> the fourth part<WH7253> of a shekel<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>: that will I give<WH5414> to the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, to tell<WH5046> us our way<WH1870>.

(Beforetime <WH6440> in Israel<WH3478>, when a man<WH376> went<WH3212> to inquire<WH1875> of God<WH430>, thus he said<WH559>, Come<WH3212>, and let us go<WH3212> to the seer<WH7200>; for he that is now<WH3117> called a Prophet<WH5030> was beforetime<WH6440> called<WH7121> a Seer<WH7200>.)
Then said<WH1697> Saul<WH7586> to his servant<WH5288>, Well<WH2896> said<WH559>; come<WH3212>, let us go<WH3212>. So they went<WH3212> unto the city<WH5892> where the man<WH376> of God was<WH430>.

As they went up<WH5927> the ascent<WH5927> to the city<WH5892>, they found<WH4672> young maidens<WH5291> going out<WH3318> to draw<WH7579> water<WH4325>, and said<WH559> unto them<WH3426>, Is the seer here<WH7200>?

And they answered<WH6030> them<WH559>, and said, He is<WH3426>; behold<WH6440>, he is before thee<WH4116>: make haste now<WH935>, for he is come to-day<WH3117> into the city<WH5892>; for the people<WH5971> have a sacrifice<WH2077> to-day<WH3117> in the high place<WH1116>:

as soon as ye are come<WH935> into the city<WH5892>, ye shall straightway<WH3651> find<WH4672> him<WH5927>, before he goeth up to the high place<WH1116> to eat<WH398>; for the people<WH5971> will not eat<WH398> until he come<WH935>, because he doth bless<WH1288> the sacrifice<WH2077>; and afterwards<WH310> they eat<WH398> that are bidden<WH7121>. Now therefore get you up<WH5927>; for at this time<WH3117> ye shall find him<WH4672>.

And they went up<WH5927> to<WH7125> the city<WH5892>; and as they came<WH935> within the city<WH5892>, behold<WH8050>, Samuel came out<WH3318> toward<WH7125> them<WH5927>, to go up to the high place<WH1116>.
Now Jehovah<WH3068> had revealed<WH1540> unto<WH241> Samuel<WH8050> a<WH259> day<WH3117> before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586> came<WH935>, saying<WH559>,

Tomorrow <WH4279> about this time<WH6256> I will send<WH7971> thee a man<WH376> out of the land<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144>, and thou shalt anoint<WH4886> him to be prince<WH5057> over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>; and he shall save<WH3467> my people<WH5971> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>: for I have looked<WH7200> upon my people<WH5971>, because their cry<WH6818> is come unto me<WH935>.

And when Samuel<WH8050> saw<WH7200> Saul<WH7586>, Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH6030> unto him<WH376>, Behold, the man of whom I spake<WH559> to thee<WH6113>! this same shall have authority over my people<WH5971>.
Then Saul<WH7586> drew near<WH5066> to Samuel<WH8050> in<WH8432> the gate<WH8179>, and said<WH559>, Tell<WH5046> me<WH335>, I pray thee, where the seer<WH7200>'s house is<WH1004>.

And Samuel<WH8050> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586>, and said<WH559>, I am the seer<WH7200>; go up<WH5927> before<WH6440> me unto the high place<WH1116>, for ye shall eat<WH398> with me to-day<WH3117>: and in the morning<WH1242> I will let thee go<WH7971>, and will tell<WH5046> thee all that is in thy heart<WH3824>.

And as for thine asses<WH860> that were lost<WH6> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> ago<WH3117>, set<WH7760> not they mind<WH3820> on them<WH4672>; for they are found. And for whom is all that is desirable<WH2532> in Israel<WH3478>? Is it not for thee<WH1>, and for all thy father's house<WH1004>?

And Saul<WH7586> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Am not I a Benjamite<WH1145>, of the smallest<WH6996> of the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>? and my family<WH4940> the least<WH6810> of all the families<WH4940> of the tribe<WH7626> of Benjamin<WH1144>? wherefore then speakest<WH1696> thou to me after this manner<WH1697>?

And Samuel<WH8050> took<WH3947> Saul<WH7586> and his servant<WH5288>, and brought<WH935> them into the guest-chamber<WH3957>, and made them sit<WH5414> in the chiefest<WH7218> place<WH4725> among them that were bidden<WH7121>, who were about thirty<WH7970> persons<WH376>.
And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> unto the cook<WH2876>, Bring<WH5414> the portion<WH4490> which I gave<WH5414> thee<WH559>, of which I said unto thee<WH7760>, Set it by thee.

And the cook<WH2876> took up<WH7311> the thigh<WH7785>, and that which was upon it<WH7760>, and set it before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586>. And Samuel said<WH559>, Behold<WH7604>, that which hath been reserved! set<WH7760> it before<WH6440> thee and eat<WH398>; because unto the appointed time<WH4150> hath it been kept<WH8104> for thee<WH559>, for I said, I have invited<WH7121> the people<WH5971>. So Saul<WH7586> did eat<WH398> with Samuel<WH8050> that day<WH3117>.
And when they were come down<WH3381> from the high place<WH1116> into the city<WH5892>, he communed<WH1696> with Saul<WH7586> upon the housetop<WH1406>.

And they arose early<WH7925>: and it came to pass about the spring<WH5927> of the day<WH7837>, that Samuel<WH8050> called<WH7121> to Saul<WH7586> on the housetop<WH1406>, saying<WH559>, Up<WH6965>, that I may send thee away<WH7971>. And Saul<WH7586> arose<WH6965>, and they went out<WH3318> both<WH8147> of them<WH8050>, he and Samuel, abroad<WH2351>.

As they were going down<WH3381> at the end<WH7097> of the city<WH5892>, Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, Bid<WH559> the servant<WH5288> pass on<WH5674> before<WH6440> us<WH5674> (and he passed on), but stand<WH5975> thou still first<WH3117>, that I may cause thee to hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of God<WH430>.
